civilopediaText.text:
Drafted men amred with muskets made by artisans, each different to the other,
and very well may or may not hit their target. That's why you form them up in lines.
This ingenious invention saves you from carrying burning sticks to lit your powder, and consecuently, faster fire rate.

How thought spinning was a good trick? Because it actually is. Now our bullets hit where we aim them.
Altough it's a pain chucking the ball inside the barrel. *sigh*
Easy and simple, just open the chamber and insert it from behind, and you are ready to shoot. This is how it should have always been.

Reloading made easier than ever, and if brake your gun, no problem mate, you'll be equiped with replacements to fix your gun.
  - I-In the middle of battle?
Yes of course! What, you thought you could go back to repair your gun? Hah, wake up little boy.
With these metalic rounds, now your troops can fight all they want under anyweather condition. They aren't very happy about it, but you will.
Capable of shooting multiple rounds without reloading, this bad boys will roll over the enemy and will be home by December, I assure you.
